author: mcx808
body:
<!--
[test Alex é è ç à_.zip](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/5904839/test.Alex.e.e.c.a_.zip)

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## Steps to reproduce

[test Alex é è ç à_.zip](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/5904878/test.Alex.e.e.c.a_.zip)

```powershell
#After downloading the attached example:
Expand-Archive '.\test Alex é è ç à_.zip' -DestinationPath outfolder
Get-ChildItem outfolder
```

## Expected behavior

```none
#File should be:
test Alex é è ç à .txt
```

## Actual behavior

```none
#Filename is
test Alex � � � � .txt

```

## Environment data

Originally noticed this behaviour in Powershell 5.1 on Windows Server 2016.
Confirmed the same behaviour on Powershell 7.1.1 on Windows 10 and macOS 11.1
This doesn't happen when extracting a zip with the windows explorer, or other tools such as 7zip.

```none

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.21286
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0ΓÇª}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0


```

comments.author: mcx808
comments.body: After I posted this I found a related enhancement request that largely deals with this issue: https://github.com/PowerShell/Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive/issues/88

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body: Thanks, @mcx808 - the comment I posted there may be of interest to you as well.

comments.author: jborean93
comments.body: I believe this should be closed in favour of the issue in Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive. That is where the code is located and should be fixed.

title: Expand-Archive does not preserve filenames with accents
